wikipedia_page.main: James Reardon was a British stage and film actor of the silent era. He also directed several films including The Glad Eye (1920).

response: The Glad Eye is a 1920 British silent comedy film directed by James Reardon and Kenelm Foss and starring James Reardon, Dorothy Minto and Hayford Hobbs.BFI.org It is an adaptation of the play Le Zebre by Paul Armont and Nicolas Nancey. It was remade as a film of the same name in 1927.
*The Glad Eye, directed by Kenelm Foss and James Reardon (UK, 1920, based on the play Le Zèbre)
|The Shadow of Evil||George A. Cooper, James Reardon||Mary Dibley, Reginald Fox||Crime||
The Shadow of Evil is a 1921 British silent crime film directed by George A. Cooper and James Reardon and starring  Mary Dibley, Reginald Fox and Cecil Humphreys.Murphy p.121
* 1920: The Glad Eye, directed by Kenelm Foss and James Reardon, based on the play Le Zèbre
